name: Taylor, Appellant, v. Allegheny County Board of Commissioners
name_abbreviation: Taylor v. Allegheny County Board of Commissioners

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
parties: Taylor, Appellant, v. Allegheny County Board of Commissioners.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Cueiam,
Decree affirmed. Cf. Hartmann v. Peterson, 438 Pa. 291, 265 A. 2d 127 (1970).
Each side to pay own costs.
Mr. Justice Robeets dissents.
opinions.author: Pee Cueiam,

attorneys: Donald F. Taylor, appellant, in propria persona.
Anthony V. DeCello, Assistant County Solicitor, Francis A. Barry, Deputy County Solicitor, and Maurice Louik, County Solicitor, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Taylor, Appellant, v. Allegheny County Board of Commissioners.
Submitted March 19, 1970.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts and Pomeroy, JJ.
Donald F. Taylor, appellant, in propria persona.
Anthony V. DeCello, Assistant County Solicitor, Francis A. Barry, Deputy County Solicitor, and Maurice Louik, County Solicitor, for appellee.
May 27, 1970:
